title: Trigger
description: A database trigger that automatically executes in response to data modification events (INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE). Enables reactive database behavior and data integrity enforcement.

timing.description: SQL 2016 trigger activation time (Part 2, Clause 11.38). BEFORE: fires before the triggering operation. AFTER: fires after the triggering operation. INSTEAD_OF: replaces the triggering operation (used for view triggers).

events.description: DML event that activates the trigger (SQL 2016 Part 2, Clause 11.38). INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE are SQL 2016 standard; TRUNCATE is a vendor extension. Multiple events can be combined by creating separate trigger entries.

forEach.description: SQL 2016 triggered action granularity (Part 2, Clause 11.38). ROW: trigger fires once per affected row. STATEMENT: trigger fires once per triggering SQL statement regardless of rows affected.
